result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Nielsen

records.addlTxt: 11:23 AM Defendant Steven A Nielsen not in court.  Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Steven A Nielsen.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court authorizes bench warrant on non-appearance - $1,000 CASH.

Defendant Steven A Nielsen appeared by video, Attorney David Vernon Penn for Steven A Nielsen appeared by video, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre trial for May 31st at 11:00 am. bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
